text.p: These are the leading stories in Zimbabwe's state-owned Herald newspaper on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- All Zimbabwean civil servants who went on a nationwide strike over two weeks ago demanding salary rises and were consequently dismissed for ignoring a government call to return to work can now go back, although they will not be paid for the days they were on strike.
- Zimbabwe's industrial training colleges have been urged to reduce the existing mismatch between the qualifications of college leavers and market requirements.
